name: Halodoom
description:
Halodoom is a fangame that pays tribute to the Halo universe and seeks to push the Doom Engine to its limits!  While utilizing the source port Zandronum, Halodoom offers a totally unique and standalone modern Halo experience within the classic engine that originally spawned the first person shooter genre!   Halodoom was a solo project I first started when I was 15 years old and had no idea how to go about making it happen. Initially brought about by a desire to play Halo on an iPod Mini after learning it could run Doom, the project soon snowballed into something that I would carry with me for half of my life, and would set me on a path of game development that I am still on today.  It has seen several iterations in the past, and gone by many names, a comfort project I could pick away at whenever I felt the urge. Now, 15 years later, it's time to finally do justice to the first game I ever made. It's time to finish this fight! FEATURES 16 Weapons and 4 Grenade Types and Classic Powerups

Halodoom's Weapons Sandbox includes : Assault Rifle, Battle Rifle, Magnum, Sniper, Rocket Launcher, Shotgun, Spiker Rifle, Mauler, Chainsaw, Plasma Pistol, Plasma Rifle, Carbine, Needler, Fuel Rod Cannon, Energy Sword, Beam Rifle, Frag Grenades, Plasma Grenades, Spike Grenades and Firebomb Grenades. You will also occasionally find an Overshield or Active Camo!

8 Armor Coatings With Adjustable Primary Color

Customize your Mark VI Armor set with 8 different coatings, combined with a slider system for primary color, you have a myriad of different aesthetic options!

Flood and Covenant Firefight With 8 Hidden Unlockable Skulls

Fight against waves of either Covenant (On the map Terminus) or Flood (On Flood Gulch). Firefight offers a range of difficulties from Easy to Mythic, as well as the option to Save/Load your game. Once you've found and unlocked Skull modifiers hidden within the various maps, you can enable them in this mode to yield some pretty absurd results!

72 Possible Game Mode Combinations!

Halodoom offers a handful of familiar game types including Slayer, Oddball, King of the Hill, Juggernaut,  Infection and SWAT (With more on the way in a future update) . Coupled with 12 unique weapon start templates, you'll never run out of variations to try out! You can also play either Free for All or as a Team!

Interactive Main Menu Map

Halodoom contains an interactive main menu with visual aids to better help you get started. Custom views will pop up for map selection, player customization and bot selection.

15 Custom Bots 

Engage in combat with these highly customized bots. If you've ever played Doom with bots you'll know they can be a bit... simplistic. These bots have custom behavior which allows them to better utilize the maps and game types.

13 Multiplayer Maps

Test your skills against bots on 13 multiplayer maps which contain classic remakes of both Halo and Doom staples, as well as a healthy dose of original creations. (Online multiplayer with custom server browser coming soon in a future update!)

Lockup - Remake of the classic Halo 2 map Lockout


Warehouse - A small and claustrophobic arena map

Submerged - A carousel of carnage Rebellion - Medium sized arena map with a great view of High Charity! Ghostship - A faithful remake of Halo 3's Heretic (Midship) Liminal - One of the only non-gimmick Halo CE maps never remade. The Rat Race is back on! Flood Gulch - A flood infested reimagining of everyone's favorite box canyon! Verdant - An elevated series of ramps and platforms suited for long range! Terminus - A remake of Halo 2 's Terminal Schism - A cyclical midsized arena map reminiscent of several Halo staples. Threshold - A reimagining of the Doom II map Entryway tailored to Halodoom's gameplay style!
